meanings.definition: To surpass or excel in leading
meanings.sent1: In the race, Sarah outleads all the other runners with her speed.
meanings.sent2: The team captain always outleads the players with her strong leadership skills.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, confident that he could outleads him.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed outleads any obstacles that come her way.
meanings.sent5: The bright torch of knowledge outleads the darkness of ignorance.

meanings.sent1: The lighthouse outleads ships safely through the rocky waters.
meanings.sent2: The tour guide outleads the group to the historical landmarks.
meanings.sent3: The compass always outleads the lost travelers back to civilization.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude outleads others towards a brighter future.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's encouragement outleads the students towards success.

meanings.definition: To be in charge or ahead in a competition
meanings.sent1: The champion boxer outleads his opponents in every match.
meanings.sent2: The top student outleads the class in academic performance.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox always outleads the other animals in the forest games.
meanings.sent4: Her strategic planning outleads the competitors in the business world.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's bravery outleads any villain's evil plans.
